title: How to Make Imam Bayildi

steps.headline: Peel your eggplant and trim the ends.
steps.description: Some recipes often leave portions of the skin on, so peel roughly. To make them attractive, peel long strips leaving a 0.5 cm 1/5 inch gap between each peel. Sprinkle with salt and put aside.

steps.headline: Heat a flame proof casserole or oven safe pan with 2 tablespoons of the oil and gently fry the eggplant until golden and tender.
steps.description: Alternatively you can brush with oil and bake at 175C / 345F until just tender, or deep fry. Put aside once cooked.

steps.headline: Heat another the pan with a good splash of the olive oil and fry the onion gently under cooked through.
steps.description: Ideally the onions should brown only slightly if at all. Add spices (if desired) and garlic, cook for another few minutes until the spices smell fragrant. Add tomatoes, chopped paprika peppers and season with salt to taste. Simmer gently for 2-3 minutes, then add lemon juice, parsley and sugar (if desired).

steps.headline: Create a pocket in each eggplant using two forks, a spoon or your finger.
steps.description: You will need to split the eggplants from top to tail to make a boat like shape, but aim to avoid breaking all the way through.

steps.headline: Spoon the onion filling into the eggplant pockets and sprinkle the tops with remaining pan juices and oil.
steps.description: Bake 20-25 minutes in the 175C / 345 oven until the vegetables just start to break down.

steps.headline: Serve hot, or at room temperature.

text: Peel your eggplant and trim the ends. Some recipes often leave portions of the skin on, so peel roughly. To make them attractive, peel long strips leaving a 0.5 cm 1/5 inch gap between each peel. Sprinkle with salt and put aside. Heat a flame proof casserole or oven safe pan with 2 tablespoons of the oil and gently fry the eggplant until golden and tender. Alternatively you can brush with oil and bake at 175C / 345F until just tender, or deep fry. Put aside once cooked. Heat another the pan with a good splash of the olive oil and fry the onion gently under cooked through. Ideally the onions should brown only slightly if at all. Add spices (if desired) and garlic, cook for another few minutes until the spices smell fragrant. Add tomatoes, chopped paprika peppers and season with salt to taste. Simmer gently for 2-3 minutes, then add lemon juice, parsley and sugar (if desired). Create a pocket in each eggplant using two forks, a spoon or your finger. You will need to split the eggplants from top to tail to make a boat like shape, but aim to avoid breaking all the way through. Spoon the onion filling into the eggplant pockets and sprinkle the tops with remaining pan juices and oil. Bake 20-25 minutes in the 175C / 345 oven until the vegetables just start to break down. Serve hot, or at room temperature.  Finished.
tyn_model: flame proof casserole or oven safe pan
